intro: Orophea rhytidophylla, commonly known as the wrinkled leaf tree, is a member of the family Gentianaceae and is native to the tropical regions of Southeast Asia. It is characterized by its distinctive, palmate leaves that are often deeply lobed and covered in a unique, wrinkled texture. The plant produces showy, yellowish to orange flowers that are typically clustered in inflorescences. It thrives in humid, shaded environments and is often found in lowland forests. Due to its ornamental value and ecological significance, it is sometimes cultivated in botanical gardens and conservation programs.
